Posner cueing task.Definition: Subjects view two stimuli (boxes, letters, etc.) and are cued by an arrow to attend to one of the stimuli.  Subjects then discriminate and respond (e.g., press a button when one of the boxes is filled with a diagonal cross, or press the left button for an and#34;Xand#34; and the right button for an and#34;Oand#34;).
